jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About NextLink Labs

NextLink Labs is a technical consulting firm specializing in helping companies build, scale, and secure their technology through custom software development, DevOps, and application security services.

Our clients range from startups to public companies, especially in regulated and complex industries like healthcare, finance, and manufacturing. Whether it’s implementing CI/CD or designing a secure cloud architecture, we’re a hands-on team known for moving fast, automating relentlessly, and coaching engineering teams as we solve complex DevOps and security challenges.

The Role

We’re hiring a Senior DevOps Engineer with GitLab expertise to lead client delivery efforts across automation, infrastructure, cloud, and CI/CD initiatives. This is a hands-on, client-facing role ideal for someone who enjoys moving fast, solving complex problems, and mentoring engineers. You’ll work across industries, helping clients modernize infrastructure and deploy with speed and security.

Key Responsibilities

  • GitLab SME with PSE certification, having experience with version upgrades and migrations.

  • Architect and implement CI/CD pipelines (GitLab, GitHub Actions, Jenkins)

  • Build and manage infrastructure as code (Terraform)

  • Lead containerization with Kubernetes, Docker, or ECS.

  • Automate deployment and operations with scripting (Python, Bash, PowerShell)

  • Apply cloud security best practices across AWS, Azure, or GCP

  • Guide clients through incident response and change management processes

  • Mentor engineers and contribute to internal delivery frameworks

  • Engage directly with clients to assess, advise, and execute solutions in agile environments

Required Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in DevOps, SRE, or Cloud Architecture roles

  • 2+ years in a consulting, shared services, or advisory environment
    (Must have supported multiple teams or clients—not embedded in a single product team)

  • Proven expertise in:

    • CI/CD: GitLab (preferred), GitHub Actions, or Jenkins

    • IAC: Terraform or equivalent

    • Containers: Kubernetes, Docker, or ECS

    • Scripting: Python, Bash, PowerShell

  • Experience with at least one major cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP)

  • Exposure to monitoring, observability, incident & change management

  • Strong communication and client collaboration skills

  • Agile delivery experience

  • Fluent in conversational English

Preferred Qualifications

  • Kubernetes certifications (CKA or CKAD)

  • Cloud certifications (AWS, Azure, or GCP)

  • Experience with config management tools (Ansible, Chef, Puppet)

  • Familiarity with monitoring tools (Grafana, Prometheus, CloudWatch, etc.)

  • Previous mentorship or internal tooling contributions

  • Enthusiastic about internal knowledge sharing and helping grow engineering culture

Why NextLink Labs

  • Work with deeply technical clients on high-impact projects

  • Join a tight-knit team that values clarity, speed, and autonomy

  • Accelerate your learning by mentoring others and building reusable delivery assets

Visa Sponsorship

  • At this time, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship or take over sponsorship for existing visas. Candidates must be authorized to work in North America without the need for current or future sponsorship.

jobs.title: Account Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About NextLink Labs

NextLink Labs is a technical consulting firm that helps companies build, scale, and secure their technology through custom software development, DevOps, and application security services.

We work with a range of companies, from startup to public companies, especially in transformational, high-stakes industries like healthcare, technology and scientific. Whether it’s refactoring legacy apps, implementing CI/CD, or designing secure cloud architecture, we’re the team clients call when the stakes are high and the problems are complex.

Key Responsibilities

We’re looking for a driven Account Executive with a hunter’s mindset. This isn’t a role where you wait for leads to come in — you’ll own your pipeline from day one, building relationships, opening doors, and driving deals across your territory. If you’re motivated by winning new business, love the thrill of the chase, and know how to close complex consulting deals, this role is for you.

What You’ll Do

  • Take full ownership of your pipeline — prospecting, qualifying, and moving deals forward.

  • Drive outbound efforts through calls, emails, LinkedIn, and networking to generate new opportunities.

  • Build strong relationships with decision-makers and stakeholders.

  • Run consultative sales cycles, uncovering needs and positioning the right solutions.

  • Consistently hit (and exceed) your sales targets by closing high-value consulting deals.

  • Collaborate with internal teams to ensure clients get real value from what we deliver.

  • Develop a network of key partners to serve as force multipliers in your territory.

Required Qualifications

  • 3+ years of B2B experience in a direct sales role with a hunter mentality — you know how to build your pipeline from scratch.

  • Strong outbound prospecting skills — comfortable creating your own opportunities.

  • Success leading complex, consultative sales cycles with technical buyers - CTOs, CISOs, VP of Engineering.

  • Excellent communication, relationship-building, and negotiation skills.

  • Conversant in DevOps, cloud infrastructure, and software development solutions from a strategic or outcomes-based perspective.

  • Comfortable taking charge, owning results, and figuring things out even when the path isn’t clear.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Background in technical consulting or professional services.

  • Experience selling into technical buyer groups or complex organizations.

  • Familiarity with CRM tools and sales automation platforms.

  • Trained in MEDDICC and comfortable using it as a guide to keep deals moving and stay focused on what matters.

Why NextLink Labs

  • We’re a technical consulting firm that values clarity, ownership, and outcomes

  • Compensation includes a competitive base salary and commission.

  • You’ll earn long-tail commission on any deal you source, even after it’s handed off. As a result, you’re rewarded for initiating valuable relationships.

  • Remote-first culture, flexible work schedule, and autonomy to do your best work.

  • Healthcare (Medical, Dental, and Vision) and 401k

Visa Sponsorship

  • At this time, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship or take over sponsorship for existing visas. Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States without the need for current or future sponsorship.

jobs.title: Go Backend Developer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About NextLink Labs

NextLink Labs is a fast growing technology firm focused on helping companies build, scale, and secure their software applications and organizations. We believe that in order for companies, teams, and products to succeed, technology must be utilized effectively and securely. We pride ourselves in helping our clients win in their respective industries.

As a remote-first company with team members spread out all across the country, NextLink Labs continuously works to ensure our work environment is comfortable and collaborative. We also aim to maintain an inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive professionally and live full lives outside of work.

Position Summary

NextLink Labs is seeking a motivated Backend Developer with a strong background in Golang to join our Custom Software Development consulting team. A successful person in this role will be tasked with building and maintaining scalable backend services and APIs for our clients and will be able to seamlessly integrate with our clients engineering teams.

Key Responsibilities

As a Backend Developer, you will design and implement robust backend systems and RESTful APIs while making critical architecture decisions to rapidly deliver features for a recently-launched application entering its "Go to Market" phase. If you are a self-motivated engineer looking to take ownership of your work, we invite you to join our team at NextLink Labs.

What You'll Do

  • Design, develop, and maintain scalable backend services and APIs using Golang

  • Work with other engineers to architect and implement microservices-based solutions

  • Communicate directly with clients to give demonstrations and receive feedback

  • Optimize database queries and application performance for high-traffic systems

  • Work in an agile team environment with daily stand ups, and weekly agile meetings

  • Engage in code reviews of your teammates' work

Required Qualifications

  • 3+ years of experience building backend services with Golang

  • Strong understanding of Golang concurrency patterns, goroutines, and channels

  • Experience designing and implementing RESTful APIs and/or GraphQL services

  • Proficiency with relational databases (PostgreSQL)

  • Ability to work independently and take ownership in a variety of software engagements

  • Ability to scope individual features and full software projects based on client requests

  • Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal skills with the ability to build buy-in, facilitate compromise, and guide client expectations

  • Strong unit-testing and debugging abilities

  • Proficient understanding of version control systems (Git)

  • Understanding of security best practices and compliance requirements

  • Understanding of fundamental design principles behind scalable and distributed systems

  • Strong problem-solving, analytical, and strategic thinking abilities, capable of making well-informed and timely decisions

Nice to Have

  • Experience integrating software platforms with e-commerce APIs (Shopify)

  • Experience with microservices architecture and message queues (Kafka)

  • Experienced with DevOps tooling (AWS, Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes)

Why NextLink Labs

This is a contractor role, open to candidates located in North or South America, offering competitive pay (in USD) and 100% remote work. Coverage for exams and certifications is provided to support your professional growth. You’ll be equipped with a state-of-the-art laptop and tools, and join an exceptional global team that fosters collaboration, learning, and continuous growth.

jobs.title: Software Architect
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About NextLink Labs

NextLink Labs is a fast growing technology firm focused on helping companies build, scale, and secure their software applications and organizations. We believe that in order for companies, teams, and products to succeed, technology must be utilized effectively and securely. We pride ourselves in helping our clients win in their respective industries.

As a remote-first company with team members spread out all across the country, NextLink Labs continuously works to ensure our work environment is comfortable and collaborative. We also aim to maintain an inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive professionally and live full lives outside of work.

Position Summary

NextLink Labs is seeking a motivated Software Architect to join our Custom Software Development consulting team. A successful person in this role has deep expertise in application design and will be tasked with building and maintaining web applications for our clients and will also possess a strategic mindset to contribute internally to improving our consulting practice.

Key Responsibilities

As a Software Architect with a strong background in Django and Python, you will design and implement robust systems, build end-to-end features for client applications, make architecture decisions to alleviate technical debt in legacy applications, and engage in technical conversations with clients to understand their pain points and how best to solve them. Your role will also encompass mentoring junior developers and assisting the team in ongoing efforts to establish internal best practices to elevate our standards of excellence. If you are a self-motivated engineer looking to take ownership of your work, we invite you to join our team at NextLink Labs.

What You'll Do

  • Design, develop, and maintain scalable backend services and APIs using Django and Python

  • Work with other engineers to architect and implement microservices-based solutions

  • Communicate directly with clients to give demonstrations and receive feedback

  • Review legacy software applications to identify and remediate technical debt

  • Work in an agile team environment with weekly stand ups

  • Engage in code reviews of your teammates' work

  • Contribute to internal NextLink Labs documentation and code template

  • Engage in thought leadership through blog posts, webinars, and other marketing materials

  • Assist Sales and Marketing by joining scoping calls and providing technical input

Required Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience building backend services with Django and Python

  • Strong understanding of Django ORM, querysets, and database optimization techniques

  • Experience designing and implementing RESTful APIs using Django REST Framework

  • Proficiency with relational databases (PostgreSQL)

  • 3+ years of experience with Ruby on Rails and React, or equivalent web frameworks

  • Ability to work independently and take ownership in a variety of software engagements

  • Ability to scope individual features and full software projects based on client requests

  • Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal skills with the ability to to build buy-in, facilitate compromise, and guide client expectations

  • Strong unit-testing and debugging abilities

  • Proficient understanding of version control systems (Git)

  • Understanding of accessibility and security compliance

  • Understanding of fundamental design principles behind a scalable application

  • Strong problem-solving, analytical, and strategic thinking abilities, capable of making well-informed and timely decisions

Nice to Have

  • Experienced with DevOps tooling (AWS, Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes)

Why NextLink Labs

  • We’re a technical consulting firm that values clarity, ownership, and outcomes

  • Competitive salary with bonus structure

  • Remote-first culture, flexible work schedule, and autonomy to do your best work.

  • Healthcare (Medical, Dental, and Vision) and 401k

  • Responsibility and autonomy at a growing company

  • The opportunity to build something big and exciting

Visa Sponsorship

  • At this time, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship or take over sponsorship for existing visas. Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States without the need for current or future sponsorship.
